column4: I'm having a weird firefox issue, While i'm browsing the internet the browser will lockup and the browser window goes grey (kind of like when you log out of a vbulleting BB). After a few minutes it will give me the option to force quit
none of my settings have changed recently, This literally just started today
when I booted up after school, anyone have any ideas?
There's a word for that.
It's a bug.
What if any extensions do you have in FF?  What specific URLs are showing that behavior?  Try disabling extensions, javascript, java, plugins, see if any of those fix the problem.
Note that FF may upgrade extensions with relatively little notice.
You might also check your syslogs for any sig11 or Northbridge errors.
Try launching under strace then.  You're going to want to log output, and there's going to be absolutely tons of it.
You can also attach gdb to the process, but without debugging symbols (eg:  if 'file <path>/firefox-bin' tells you it's a stripped ELF binary there's not much good'.
'man strace'.
trace system calls made by an executable.
Basically tells you what a given process is doing.
Alternately, you can launch FF, and attach strace to its PID when it's hung and see what it's doing.  Again, copious output, but less than if you launch FF.
Sec.
Launch FF normally.
ps waux | awk '/[f] iref/ {print $2}'
... gives you the PID.  Should be one value.
'strace -p <PID>'
Can launch that under strace but it's a bit complicated w/ firefox in particular.
One other trick is to remove your profile (just renaming it is enough), restart FF, and see if that fixes the problem.
Often there's something in your profile that's bugging FF.  Move a few files back at a time to see which causes the problem.
thaks, I'll see what I can do. I'm glad to know its FF fault and not ubuntu. I don't think i could afford another re install
This is Linux.  Reinstalls aren't required.
